article_title: Employees Pay a Price to Retain Right to Sue
article_text:
Companies have been aggressively trying to stem the costs of lawsuits by asking and sometimes requiring employees to give up their right to take the boss to court.

The U.S. arm of German pharmaceuticals firm Boehringer Ingelheim recently took the idea one step further, barring employees from receiving sales commissions if they didn't agree to pursue complaints against the company in arbitration, rather than in court.
